definition: letter/mail/CL:封[feng1]/to trust/to believe/to profess faith in/truthful/confidence/trust/at will/at random
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: Quality and reliable service, abide by the contract is our company's goal.
sentences.chinese: 质量可靠，服务周到，信守合同是我公司的一贯宗旨。

sentences.english: But Eragon owes his loyalty to others, too.
sentences.chinese: 就在同时，他也要信守他对其他人的忠诚。

sentences.english: But you cannot take away my freedom to be true to my conscience.
sentences.chinese: 但是你不能剥夺我信守我的良知的自由。

sentences.english: I will treat people sincerely and keep my promises.
sentences.chinese: 我要以诚待人，要信守承诺。

sentences.english: The government stuck to their election pledges.
sentences.chinese: 政府信守他们的竞选誓约。

sentences.english: Keep your promise, his first heart is the wind.
sentences.chinese: 信守自己的诺言，是风臣人最初的本心。

sentences.english: One must honor his contract and keep his word.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都应当尊重合同，信守诺言。

sentences.english: We must hold to the principles of justice.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须信守正义的原则。

sentences.english: She says I can't keep my promises and I never take her seriously.
sentences.chinese: 她说我无法信守承诺，而且从不把她当一回事。

sentences.english: It's our principle in business to "Honor the contract and keep our promise".
sentences.chinese: 我们做生意遵循的原则是“重信守诺”。

sentences.english: Undertake not what you cannot perform, but be careful to keep your promise.
sentences.chinese: 不要承你完成不了的事情，但一定要信守诺言。

sentences.english: He must abide by the contract.
God was true to promise made to Jacob at Bethel.
sentences.chinese: 上帝信守在伯特利对雅各的许诺。

sentences.english: Dumas kept the Republican political views, against the monarchy.
sentences.chinese: 大仲马信守共和政见，反对君主专政。

sentences.english: One should keep to one's promise.
Your answer sucked, but I’ll keep my end of the bargain.
sentences.chinese: 你的答案是狗屁，但我还是会信守诺言。

definition: a promise worth one thousand in gold (idiom); a promise that must be kept
to speak and keep one's promise (idiom); as good as one's word
(idiom) one's actions are in keeping with what one says
to go against/to be contrary to/to violate
to maintain/to adhere to/to observe (an injunction etc)
to hold fast to/to stick to
